Package uk.ac.ed.inf.aqmaps.application

Class OutputGenerator

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.ed.inf.aqmaps.application.OutputGenerator
public class OutputGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
Instances of this class can be used to turn the data gathered by our drone into output files.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int day  
    private MainDrone drone  
    private int month  
    private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> pollutionTierToMarkerSymbol  
    private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> pollutionTierToRgb  
    private int year  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    OutputGenerator​(int day, int month, int year, MainDrone drone)
    The constructor of the OutputGenerator class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private int computeTierForReading​(double reading)
    This helper method computes the "pollution tier" of a given air quality measurement.
    private com.mapbox.geojson.FeatureCollection generateFeatureCollection()
    Given the list of relevant sensors and our main drone after it has returned from its tour, this method turns the gathered data, consisting of visited locations and sensor readings, into a Mapbox FeatureCollection.
    private java.lang.String generateGeoJSONFileName()
    This helper method generates the name of the GeoJSON file corresponding to the drone's output, in the appropriate format.
    void writeFeatureCollectionToFile()
    This method generates a String in JSON format for a Mapbox GeoJSON FeatureCollection it first generates, and writes it to a file with the appropriate name.
    void writeFlightPathToFile()
    This method writes the "move history" of our main drone (in the required format) to a .txt output file, after the drone has returned from its tour.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • OutputGenerator

      public OutputGenerator​(int day, int month, int year, MainDrone drone)
      The constructor of the OutputGenerator class.
      Parameters:
      day - the day of month of the drone's tour
      month - the month of the drone's tour
      year - the year of the drone's tour
      drone - the main drone used in this run of the app

  • Method Details

    • computeTierForReading

      private int computeTierForReading​(double reading)
      This helper method computes the "pollution tier" of a given air quality measurement. The tier later decides the colour and symbol corresponding to the according sensor.
      Parameters:
      reading - the reading corresponding to a sensor on a given day (already having taken into account the battery)
      Returns:
      the pollution tier corresponding to the reading (0 for 0-32, 1 for 32-64, ..., 7 for 224-256)

    • writeFeatureCollectionToFile

      public void writeFeatureCollectionToFile()
      This method generates a String in JSON format for a Mapbox GeoJSON FeatureCollection it first generates, and writes it to a file with the appropriate name.

    • generateFeatureCollection

      private com.mapbox.geojson.FeatureCollection generateFeatureCollection()
      Given the list of relevant sensors and our main drone after it has returned from its tour, this method turns the gathered data, consisting of visited locations and sensor readings, into a Mapbox FeatureCollection.
      Returns:
      a FeatureCollection corresponding to the gathered data

    • generateGeoJSONFileName

      private java.lang.String generateGeoJSONFileName()
      This helper method generates the name of the GeoJSON file corresponding to the drone's output, in the appropriate format.
      Returns:
      the file name of the output .geojson file

    • writeFlightPathToFile

      public void writeFlightPathToFile() throws java.io.IOException
      This method writes the "move history" of our main drone (in the required format) to a .txt output file, after the drone has returned from its tour.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throw an IOException in case something goes wrong - Error Handling done in main method to increase readability
